Become an Approved Training Provider

Colleges, universities and non-public institutions provide technical (or classroom) training for B.C.'s apprenticeship and pre-apprenticeship programs. SkilledTradesBC awards credit for training only from Approved Training Providers who meet our program standards. 

[ See the List](/all-approved-training-providers-list)

Application

Process

[ How to Apply](/apply-approved-training-provider)

Program Standards Updates

When there is a significant change in a program standard, SkilledTradesBC will post a notification bulletin called an Official Program Standards Notification (OPSN).

[ View Latest Updates](/program-standards-updates)

Program

Resources

On each trade program page, you’ll find useful resources including exam weighting charts, record books, program outlines, transition plans, and more. 

[ All Trade Programs](/find-your-trade)

Pan-Canadian Harmonization Initiative

The Canadian Council of Directors of Apprenticeship (CCDA) is leading the harmonization of apprenticeship systems across Canada by making apprenticeship training requirements more consistent in the Red Seal trades.

[ View Upcoming Harmonization Trades](/training-providers/pan-canadian-harmonization-initiative)
